subject: Trigger periodic OCC POLL commands when the OCCs are running
commitMessage:
Trigger periodic OCC POLL commands when the OCCs are running

The OCC control app will periodically trigger kernel poll commands
to the OCC when the OCCs are active.
Code change also adds an interface to allow any OCC command to be
sent to an OCC. The pass-through interface was also updated to
use the new command object.

Tested: I did several IPLs on multiple Rainier systems to verify
the changes. I forced OCC resets to ensure polling stopped when
OCCs were disabled and restarted after it came out of reset.

Change-Id: I56970e781a988bb94f17ac38173ace8a68bb5fad
Signed-off-by: Chris Cain <cjcain@us.ibm.com>

Patch Set 10:

What happens to the existing kernel polling? That will still be happening as long as anyone reads any OCC hwmon files.
I guess I'm not understanding the need to pull the polling into userspace.

Patch Set 10:

> Patch Set 10:
> 
> What happens to the existing kernel polling? That will still be happening as long as anyone reads any OCC hwmon files.
> I guess I'm not understanding the need to pull the polling into userspace.

I thought we were moving away from kernel polling, but discussed further with Eddie.  He explained that the hwmon kernel driver's job is to monitor the hardware and export any data needed.  He wanted to be sure we are not double polling the OCC.  I will update the code to no longer send a new poll command to the OCC but instead trigger a kernel poll by reading the OCC state from sysfs file.

This is called in Manager::pollerTimerExpired() and it used to trigger the kernel to send a poll command to the OCC. (via sysfs)
The lastState is used to trace OCC state changes since they should be very rare, but good to know when they happen.
